main_definition: The state of being exactly contrary or completely different; the direct contrast to something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In position, direction, nature, etc., diametrically opposed to something else.
meanings_and_examples.example: The two buildings are located on opposite sides of the street.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Contrary or very different in kind; directly contrasting an aspect of something.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has a completely opposite personality compared to her twin sister, who is outgoing and friendly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In thought, feeling, etc., diametrically opposed to each other; polar opposites.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their political views are on the opposite ends of the spectrum; one supports capitalism while the other advocates for socialism.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in card games or sports when players face each other across a table, field, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: In tennis, two opponents play on opposite sides of the court.
